citeinfo.title: Edgematched Entities Surrounding the State of MN and Lake Superior

descript.abstract: This is a derived layer that includes the state borders of Wisconsin, Iowa, Michigan, Canada, North and South Dakota, as well as, Lake Superior. All features have been edge matched to each other. To see originating metadata for each layer follow the links below. Iowa North Dakota Michigan North Dakota North Dakota South Dakota: None available Wisconsin Canadian Provinces: None available Lake Superior
descript.purpose: This dataset was developed to create a nicely edge matched surround for use in web applications or paper maps, so that MN would not appear as an island.
descript.supplinf: MN, WI, ND, SD, IA, MI, Canada

timeperd.current: Unless state borders change it should be current.

place.placekey: Minnesota, South Dakota, North Dakota, Canada (Provinces), Wisconsin, Michigan, Lake Superior

dataqual.complete: The data does not seek to represent the full continental United States and Canada, only the entiities that appear in a full extent zoom of the state of MN.

procstep.procdesc:
The following datasets where edge matched with MN as the definitive source where it was in contact and otherwise it was a mix of the two borders, none were very far off, but enough to make the map look messy.
- Canadian Provinces - State of Wisconsin - State of Iowa - State of Michigan - State of North Dakota - State of South Dakota - Lake Superior

distinfo.distliab: This data was developed by the Minnesota Department of Agriculture (MDA) for its own internal business purposes. The user accepts the data 'as is', and is responsible for any consequences resulting from its use. The user should consult the data documentation for this particular data to determine its limitations and the precision with which it may depict distance, direction, location, or other geographic features. By accepting this data, the user agrees not to transmit this data or provide access to it or any part of it to another party unless the user shall include with the data a copy of this disclaimer.
